reasoning: DFN74 is one of >100 rare autosomal recessive nonsyndromic hearing loss genes. Extremely rare genetic condition with <10 families reported in medical literature. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births. No systematic epidemiological registry data available for this specific genetic subtype.
source: Hildebrand MS et al. (2010). Mutations in the ACTG1 gene that cause autosomal dominant and autosomal recessive hearing loss. Hear Res. 270(1-2):42-48
